article.title: Inflationary magneto-(non)genesis, increasing kinetic couplings, and the strong coupling problem

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements best describes the schematic evolution of I shown in Figure 1?
choices: I is constant throughout the evolution.
I decreases during inflation and increases after.
I increases during inflation and decreases after.
I is constant during inflation and decreases after.

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the field χ after the end of inflation according to Figure 2?
choices: It undergoes damped oscillations and settles at χ = 0.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 compares the evolution of  ¯I(ϕ, χ) with a<sup>2</sup>(t). What does this comparison indicate?
choices: ¯I(ϕ, χ) scales as a<sup>2</sup>(t) during the entire evolution.
¯I(ϕ, χ) scales as a<sup>2</sup>(t) only during inflation.
¯I(ϕ, χ) scales as a<sup>-2</sup>(t) during inflation.
The electric field power spectrum at present time.
The magnetic field power spectrum at the end of inflation.
The magnetic field power spectrum at present time.
The energy density of the magnetic field at the end of inflation.
